title: Plan save data model (player + world)
description:
Current behavior:
- main.lua saves a single `world_state.json` on `love.quit` when the world scene is active; load runs at startup if the file parses. Normalization only rebuilds chunk descriptors/props and clears runtime spawn tables.
- Persisted fields are limited to world seed/chunk config/start biome data, minimap visibility/zoom, visitedChunks, and generatedChunks (biome, transition, descriptors, props, defeatedFoes, lootedStructures). Player state (position, stats, health/mana, XP, potions, skills), inventory/equipment, ground loot, and timers are not saved, so reloads spawn a fresh character into a partially persisted world.

Plan for save data model:
- Add a schema version and slot metadata to the save payload so future migrations can validate data.
- Player payload: position, baseStats, health/mana current+max, combat/range, movement (speed/modifiers), experience (level/currentXP/unallocated points), potion counts + cooldownRemaining, skills (equipped slots plus allocations/availablePoints), inventory (full item rolls including affixes/stats/sprite/source/gold), and equipment slot assignments.
- World payload: chunk config (chunkSize/activeRadius/worldSeed/start biome flags), startBiomeCenter/radius/forceStartBiome, spawnSafeZone, visitedChunks, generatedChunks including zone names, transition data, props, defeatedFoes, and lootedStructures, plus minimap state (visible/zoom). Preserve chunk seeds/zone seeds when present to avoid renaming on reload.
- Runtime entities: capture ground loot (item/potion/gold with positions and despawn timers) so drops persist across sessions; ignore ephemeral render/physics state that can be recomputed.

Integration hooks:
- Extend WorldScene:serializeState to emit the player/world payload and wire a loader path that hydrates Player.new with saved components before applying stats/equipment.
- Validate decoded saves and provide safe fallbacks so corrupt files or missing fields do not crash load.
- Coordinate with save slot UI, autosave policy, corruption handling, and main menu load wiring so serialization feeds those features.
